dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 2449 RH: To authorize the President to extend the term of the Agreement for Cooperation between the Government of the United States of America and the Government of the Republic of Korea Concerning Civil Uses of Nuclear Energy for a period not to exceed March 19, 2016.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Royce (for himself, Mr. Engel, Mr. Chabot, Mr. Faleomavaega, Mr. Poe of Texas, Mr. Kinzinger of Illinois, and Mr. Collins of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

Additional sponsors: Mr. Roskam, Mr. Radel, Ms. Gabbard, Mr. Wilson of South Carolina, Ms. Meng, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Pierluisi, Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, Mr. Cook, Mr. Meeks, Mr. Rohrabacher, Mr. McCaul, Mr. McDermott, Mr. Perry, Mr. Meadows, Mr. Franks of Arizona, Mr. Bera of California, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Castro of Texas, Mr. King of New York, Mr. Messer, Mr. Salmon, Ms. Bass, Mr. Vargas, Mr. Higgins, Mr. Cicilline, Mr. Cotton, Mr. Barton, Mr. Holding, Mr. Stockman, Mr. Larsen of Washington, Mr. Bentivolio, Mr. DeSantis, Ms. Ros-Lehtinen, and Mr. Pearce
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To authorize the President to extend the term of the Agreement for Cooperation between the Government of the United States of America and the Government of the Republic of Korea Concerning Civil Uses of Nuclear Energy for a period not to exceed March 19, 2016.

section.header: Authority to extend the United States-Republic of Korea Nuclear Cooperation Agreement
section.text: The President is authorized to extend the term of the Agreement for Cooperation between the Government of the United States of America and the Government of the Republic of Korea Concerning Civil Uses of Nuclear Energy for a period not to exceed March 19, 2016, notwithstanding any other provision of law.

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
